This should ensure  that the following stylesheet processing instruction is honored by  these new browser versions. For some more background you might want  to visit the following bug report:  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=338621  --> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/WebResource.axd?d=OG6ICBS3XdykvyL_wBngEtwfPZ1xqVL3SJbFznhjfEgbO7QCYjHbDfgdgnO_5IYl31FcIeZ2u_qHqs8zCgU_y6DDpKxLyAV4MxNJVxfxbqAA9wnJHfwytgbvEYfRnFp2CKySbJEfaqzaXNpSNK6oTGhGshY1&t=635319500310794128" media="screen"?> <feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:content="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">   <title>Psychology</title>   <subtitle>Nottingham's School of Psychology is one of the leading psychology departments for research and teaching in the UK and was awarded 24 out of 24 for excellence in teaching by the UK Quality Assurance Agency. We offer excellent computing and experimental equipment such as eye-trackers and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scanners.</subtitle>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/psychology/psychology.aspx?RelatedItemsasStandardList_SyndicationType=2" />   <generator>Contensis: http://www.contentmanagement.co.uk</generator>   <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/psychology/psychology.aspx?SyndicationType=2</id>   <updated>2015-03-12T01:22:26Z</updated>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/psychology/psychology.aspx?SyndicationType=2" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml" />   <entry>     <title>Psychology BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/psychology/bsc-psychology.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Gabrielle Wright</name>     </author>     <summary>This course aims to provide you with a well-rounded education in the principles of psychology. It is intellectually challenging and coherent, and benefits from the strong research ethos of the School. The teaching programme provides a solid understanding of psychological theories and concepts, and the knowledge, analytical tools and skills needed to assess and conduct empirical research.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:55:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-10-17T17:01:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/psychology/bsc-psychology.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Psychology MSci</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/psychology/msci-psychology.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>This course aims to provide you with a well-rounded education in the principles of psychology. It is intellectually challenging and coherent, and benefits from the strong research ethos of the School. The teaching programme provides a solid understanding of psychological theories and concepts, and the knowledge, analytical tools and skills needed to assess and conduct empirical research.</summary>     <published>2015-01-15T13:58:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-01-15T13:43:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/psychology/msci-psychology.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Psychology and Cognitive Neuroscience BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/psychology/bsc-psychology-cognitive-neuroscience.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>This course shares the same aims of the single honours BSc Psychology course, providing you with a well-rounded education in the principles of psychology, but with a particular emphasis on cognitive neuroscience. You will develop particular skills in laboratory methods in brain imaging, in the real-time control of behavioural measurement, and in physiological psychology.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:59:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-11-26T11:34:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/psychology/bsc-psychology-cognitive-neuroscience.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Psychology and Philosophy BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/psychology/psychology-philosophy.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Gabrielle Wright</name>     </author>     <summary>The Psychology and Philosophy course shares the same aims as the single honours BSc Psychology course, providing you with a well-rounded education in the principles of psychology and philosophy.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:55:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-10-17T17:03:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/psychology/psychology-philosophy.aspx</id>   </entry> </feed>
